data.name: Find the deadnauts
data.description:
Deadnauts are cruising in the spaceship lost in the universe.

Your task is to find them.

Implement a Simulator object that will be initialized with information about the ship - it's mass and it's initial velocity.

Ships get caught in gravity wells etc. and their course may be changed. Therefore, simulator may be additionaly initialized with array of events - every event consists of a beginning time, duration and force vector (the force is applied to the ship for given duration since begin time).

Events cannot overlap other events in time.

Assume the ship always starts at point (0,0,0);

The Simulator.findThem function should take time as an argument and return position of the ship in given time.

These are some basic formulas to get you started:
```
velocity = distance/time
acceleration = velocity/time
acceleration = force/mass
```

Above formulas work for instantaneous vectors.

Please ignore relativistic effects.

All input will be valid (no negative masses etc.).

Reference on dynamics: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newton%27s_laws_of_motion
